name: lib/behaviorRunner.js
BehaviorRunner
description:
A thin wrapper around the execution of a behaviors actions
in order to support behavior pausing.

A behavior is in a paused state when the property `$WBBehaviorPaused`,
found on the `window` object, is truthy and when that property is
falsy the behavior is considered in an un-paused state.

The check for a behavior pause state transitions is done
before performing the behaviors next action, allowing the
action to be atomic.

params.name: behaviorStepIterator
params.description:
An async iterator that
yields the state of the behavior.

types: function(results: {done: boolean, value: *}): {done: boolean, wait: boolean}
params.name: postStepFN
params.description:
An optional
function that is supplied the state of the behavior after performing an action.
It is required that this function returns the state unmodified or a transformation
of the state that is either an object that contains the original value of the done property
or a boolean that is the value of the original done property.

name: stepIterator
description: The behavior's action iterator

name: postStepFN

types: function(result: {done: boolean, value: *}): {done: boolean, wait: boolean}

name: swapBehaviorIterator
description: Swaps the behavior actions to be applied to the page.

params.name: newBehaviorIterator
params.description: a new behavior action iterator to be run

types: function(results: {done: boolean, value: *}): {done: boolean, wait: boolean}
params.name: newPostStepFN
params.description:
an optional new post step function
to be used. If a previous postStepFN is in use and a new function is not supplied the old one is persisted.

name: swapPostStepFn
description: Swaps the postStepFN to be used.

types: function(results: {done: boolean, value: *}): {done: boolean, wait: boolean}
params.name: newPostStepFN
params.description:
The new
postStepFN to be used.

name: waitToBeUnpaused
description:
Returns a promise that resolves once `window.$WBBehaviorPaused`
is falsy, checking at 2 second intervals.

name: performStep
description:
Calls the next function of {@link BehaviorRunner#stepIterator} and
if a postStepFN was supplied it is called with the results of
the performed action otherwise they are returned directly.

name: step
description:
Initiates the next action of a behavior.

If the behavior is transitioning into the paused state (previously not paused)
the promise returned resolves with the results of performing the next
action once the un-paused state has been reached.

If this method is called and the behavior is currently in the paused state
the promise returned is the same one returned when transitioning into the
paused state.

Otherwise the returned promise resolves with the state of the behavior
after performing an action.

name: pause
description: Pauses the behavior by setting the behavior paused flag to true

name: unpause
description: Un-pauses the behavior by setting the behavior paused flag to false

name: [Symbol.asyncIterator]
description: Shortcut for running a behavior from a for await of loop.

name: initRunnableBehavior
description:
Performs the setup required for integration with Webrecorders automation system
Adds as propeties to the supplied window object
 - $WBBehaviorStepIter$: the supplied `behaviorStepIterator`
 - $WBBehaviorRunner$: the instance of the class that wraps the behaviors actions
 - $WRIteratorHandler$: a function that initiates a behaviors action

params.name: win
params.description: The window object

types: function(results: {done: boolean, value: *}): {done: boolean, wait: boolean}
params.name: postStepFN

name: lib/browser.js
waitForHistoryManipToChangeLocation
description:
Waits for the value of `window.location.href` to differ from
the supplied value due to browser history manipulation. If actual navigation
causes a change this function is useless.  The default poll rate is 1 second
and the safety timeout is 5 seconds.

params.name: previousLocation
params.description:
The value of `window.location.href` prior
to the pending or already occurred history manipulation of `window.location`

params.name: options
params.description:
Optional options
for controlling the checks poll rate and the safety timeout length.
Supplied values for `pollRate` and `safety` in milliseconds.

return.description:
Returns false if no change was detected by
the timeout length determined by options.safety otherwise true.

name: locationEquals
description:
Determines the strict equality of the string
to the value of `window.location.href`

params.name: someLocation
params.description: The expect location.href value

name: locationContains
description:
Determines if `window.location.href` contains
the supplied value as a substring.

params.name: something
params.description:
The value to determine if
it is a substring of `window.location.href`

name: lib/clicks.js
click
description:
Calls the click function on the supplied element if non-null/defined.
Returns true or false to indicate if the click happened

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to be clicked

return.description: T/F to indicate that click happened.

name: clickInContext
description:
Calls the click function on the supplied element if non-null/defined
that exists in the JS context of the supplied window (cntx).
Returns true or false to indicate if the click happened

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to be clicked

params.name: cntx
params.description: The context window

return.description: T/F to indicate that click happened.

name: clickWithDelay
description:
Calls the click method of the supplied element and waits the
specified delayTime after clicking IFF the supplied element was
non-null/undefined.

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to be clicked

params.name: delayTime
params.description: How long is the delay after click

return.description:
A Promise that resolves to T/F
indicating if the click happened

name: clickWithDelay2
description:
Calls the click method of the supplied element and waits the
specified delayTime after clicking IFF the supplied element was
non-null/undefined.

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to be clicked

params.name: options
params.description:
Options controlling
how long the delay is (delay time) and or a supplied window object of an iframe
we are clicking an element within (cntx)

return.description:
A Promise that resolves to T/F
indicating if the click happened

name: clickInContextWithDelay
description:
Calls the click method of the supplied element that exists in
the JS context of the supplied window object (cntx) and waits the
specified delayTime after clicking IFF the supplied element was
non-null/undefined.

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to be clicked

params.name: cntx
params.description: The context window

params.name: delayTime
params.description: How long is the delay after click

return.description:
A Promise that resolves to T/F
indicating if the click happened

name: scrollIntoViewAndClick
description:
Scrolls the supplied element into view and clicks it if the
element is non-null/undefined

params.name: elem
params.description:
The element to be scrolled into view
and clicked.

return.description: T/F to indicate that the click happened

name: scrollIntoViewAndClick2
description:
Scrolls the supplied element into view and clicks it if the
element is non-null/undefined

params.name: elem
params.description:
The element to be scrolled into view
and clicked.

params.name: cntx
params.description:
Optional window object associated with the iframe
the element lives in

return.description: T/F to indicate that the click happened

name: scrollIntoViewAndClickWithDelay
description:
Scrolls the supplied element into view and clicks it if the
element is non-null/undefined and waits for the specified delay time

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to be

params.name: delayTime
params.description: How long is the delay

return.description:
A Promise that resolves to T/F indicating
that the click happened

name: scrollIntoViewAndClickWithDelay2
description:
Scrolls the supplied element into view and clicks it if the
element is non-null/undefined and waits for the specified delay time

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to be

params.name: options
params.description:
Options controlling
how long the delay is (delay time) and or a supplied window object of an iframe
we are clicking an element within (cntx)

return.description:
A Promise that resolves to T/F indicating
that the click happened

name: scrollAllIntoViewAndClick
description:
Scrolls into view and clicks all the elements
present in the supplied array.

params.name: elems
params.description:
The array of elements
to be scrolled into view and clicked

name: scrollAllIntoViewAndClickWithDelay
description:
Scrolls into view and clicks all the elements
present in the supplied array waiting for the supplied
delay time after each click of an element in the array.

params.name: elems
params.description:
The array of elements
to be scrolled into view and clicked

params.name: delayTime
params.description: How long is the delay after click

name: selectElemAndClick
description:
Clicks the element from executing document.querySelector using
the supplied selector

params.name: selector
params.description: the css selector to use

return.description: T/F to indicate that the click happened

name: selectElemAndClickWithDelay
description:
Clicks the element from executing document.querySelector using
the supplied selector and waiting the specified delay time after clicking

params.name: selector
params.description: the css selector to use

params.name: delayTime
params.description: How long is the delay

return.description:
A Promise that resolves to T/F indicating
that the click happened

name: selectElemFromAndClick
description:
Clicks the element from executing querySelector using
the supplied selector using the supplied element

params.name: selectFrom
params.description: element to use for the querySelector call

params.name: selector
params.description: the css selector to use

return.description: T/F to indicate that the click happened

name: selectElemFromAndClickWithDelay
description:
Clicks the element from executing querySelector using
the supplied selector from the supplied element and waiting the specified delay time after clicking

params.name: selectFrom
params.description: element to use for the querySelector call

params.name: selector
params.description: the css selector to use

params.name: delayTime
params.description: How long is the delay

return.description:
A Promise that resolves to T/F indicating
that the click happened

name: clickAndWaitFor
description: Clicks the supplied element and then waits for the supplied predicate function to return true

params.name: elem
params.description: the element to be clicked

params.name: predicate
params.description: function returning true or false indicating the wait condition is satisfied

return.description: A Promise that resolves to T/F indicating that the click happened

name: selectClickAndWaitFor
description:
Clicks the element returned by calling querySelector using the selector
on document or the supplied element (selectFrom) and then waits for the supplied
predicate function to return true

params.name: selector
params.description: the css selector to use

params.name: predicate
params.description: function returning true or false indicating the wait condition is satisfied

params.name: selectFrom
params.description: optional element to use for the querySelector(selector) call

return.description: A Promise that resolves to T/F indicating that the click happened

name: selectFromAndClickNTimes
description:
Clicks the element returned from result of calling querySelector using the supplied
selector on the supplied element N number of times. Note that the evaluation of the querySelector
is done all N times.

params.name: selectFrom
params.description: element to use for the querySelector(selector) call

params.name: selector
params.description: the css selector to use

params.name: n
params.description:
How many times to click the element returned by
performing selectFrom.querySelector(selector)

name: selectFromAndClickNTimesWithDelay
description:
Clicks the element returned from result of calling querySelector using the supplied
selector on the supplied element N number of times and waits for delay time afters each click.
Note that the evaluation of the querySelector is done all N times.

params.name: selectFrom
params.description: The element to use to call querySelector(selector) on

params.name: selector
params.description: the css selector to use

params.name: n
params.description:
How many times to click the element returned by
performing selectFrom.querySelector(selector)

params.name: delayTime
params.description: How long is the delay

name: selectFromAndClickUntilNullWithDelay
description:
Clicks the element returned from result of calling querySelector using the supplied
selector on the supplied element until the results of the evaluting the selector returns null/undefined,
waiting for delay time afters each click.

params.name: selectFrom
params.description: The element to use to call querySelector(selector) on

params.name: selector
params.description:
the css selector to use
performing selectFrom.querySelector(selector)

params.name: options
params.description: options about delayTime and safety time

name: lib/delays.js
DelayAmount1Second
description: 1 second in milliseconds

name: DelayAmount2Seconds
description: 2the second in milliseconds

name: DelayAmount3Seconds
description: 3 second in milliseconds

name: DelayAmount4Seconds
description: 4 second in milliseconds

name: DelayAmount5Seconds
description: 5 second in milliseconds

name: secondsToDelayAmount
description:
Converts the supplied n number of seconds into milliseconds
which is required for setTimeout and setInterval

params.name: n
params.description: The number of seconds to be delayed

return.description: The delay amount in milliseconds

name: resolveWhenBehaviorUnPaused
description:
Returns a Promise that resolves once
the behavior has been un-paused

name: setIntervalP
description:
Polls the supplied function at the timeout rate
only if the behavior is not paused

return.description: The id of the interval

name: setTimeoutP
description:
Like setTimeout except that the timeout respects the pause state
of the behavior

return.description: The id of the timeout

name: delay
description:
Returns a Promise that resolves after waiting the amount of time
specified by delayTime.

params.name: delayTime
params.description: The length of the delay in milliseconds

name: waitForPredicate
description:
Returns a promise that resolves once the supplied predicate function
returns a truthy value.

params.name: predicate
params.description:
A predicate function that
returns a truthy value to indicate the wait condition was satisfied otherwise
a falsy value to indicate wait condition not satisfied

params.name: pollRate
params.description:
The length of time, in milliseconds,
that the predicate is to be polled at

name: waitForPredicateAtMax
description:
Returns a promise that resolves when the supplied predicate function
returns a truthy value or the maximum wait time has been reached.

params.name: predicate
params.description:
A predicate function that
returns a truthy value to indicate the wait condition was satisfied otherwise
a falsy value to indicate wait condition not satisfied

params.name: options
params.description:
Either a
number (time in milliseconds) representing the maximum wait time for the
supplied predicate to return a truthy value or an object with properties
pollRate (optional, controls the interval rate the supplied predicate will be polled
at), max (how long to wait for the supplied predicate to return a truthy value)

name: waitForAndSelectElement
description:
Calls `fromNode.querySelector` using the supplied selector. If the
return value of the first calls is null/undefined then waits for the same call
to return a truthy value and then returns the element the selector matches.

params.name: fromNode
params.description:
The element the
to select `selector` from

params.name: selector
params.description:
The querySelector to use for `fromNode.querySelector`
call.

params.name: pollRate
params.description:
The length of time, in milliseconds,
that the predicate is to be polled at

name: domCompletePromise
description:
Returns a promise that resolves once
`document.readyState === 'complete'`

name: waitForAdditionalElemChildren
description:
Waits for the number children of the supplied parentElement
to become greater than the supplied `currentChildCount`

params.name: parentElement
params.description: The parent

name: lib/dom.js
xpathSnapShot
description:
Returns the results of evaluating the supplied
xpath query using an optional context `contextElement`, defaults
to document, as XPathResult.ORDERED_NODE_SNAPSHOT_TYPE

params.name: xpathQuery
params.description: The xpath query to be evaluated

params.name: contextElement
params.description:
Optional
element to be used as the context of the evaluation

return.description: The results of the xpath query evaluation

name: xpathSnapShotArray
description:
Provides the same functionality of the chrome console utility `$x`
but likely less performant

params.name: xpathQuery
params.description: The xpath query to be evaluated

params.name: contextElement
params.description:
Optional
element to be used as the context of the evaluation

return.description: The results of the xpath query evaluation

name: maybePolyfillXPG
description:
Ensures that if the value of the chrome console utility $x
is not the actual utility (jquery is on the page) the returned
function behaves exactly like it.

name: qs
description: Utility function for `(document||element).querySelector(selector)`

params.name: selector
params.description: the selector to be use

params.name: context
params.description: element to use rather than document for the querySelector call

name: filteredQs
description: Utility function for `(document||element).querySelector(selector)`

params.name: selector
params.description: the selector to be use

name: qsa
description: Utility function for `document.querySelectorAll(selector)`

params.name: selector
params.description: the selector to be use

params.name: context
params.description: element to use rather than document for the querySelector call

name: id
description: Utility function for `document.getElementById(id)`

params.name: eid
params.description: The id of the element to get

params.name: context
params.description:
Optional document element to use rather than
the current JS context's

name: maybeRemoveElem
description:
Removes the element selected by the supplied querySelector, if it exits,
returning true to indicate the element was removed and false otherwise

params.name: selector
params.description: the selector to be use

params.name: context
params.description: element to use rather than document for the querySelector call

name: maybeRemoveElemById
description:
Removes the element with the supplied id, if it exits, returning
true to indicate the element was removed and false otherwise

params.name: eid
params.description: The id of the element to remove

params.name: context
params.description:
Optional document element to use rather than
the current JS context's

name: elemOffsetTopZero
description: Returns true if the supplied elements `offsetTop === 0`

params.name: elem
params.description:
The element to check its
offsetTop

name: markElemAsVisited
description:
Marks the supplied element as visited by adding the marker
to its classList.

params.name: elem
params.description:
The element to mark
as visited

params.name: marker
params.description:
Optional marker to use
defaults to `wrvistited`

name: addBehaviorStyle
description:
Creates a style tag if one was not created before and adds
the supplied `styleDef` to it. If a style tag was created before
this function is a no-op

params.name: styleDef
params.description: The CSS rules to add

return.description:
An object containing the selectors as key value pairs
where the keys are the selectors in camelcase and the value is the raw selector

name: canAcessIf
description:
Determines if the supplied iframe is accessible from this
origin. Test is that access the window object of the iframes contentWindow
does not throw an exception and the contentDocument is not falsy.

params.name: iframe
params.description: The iframe to determine accessibility

return.description: True if the iframe is accessible and false otherwise

name: selectorExists
description: Determines if the element the supplied selector selects exists

params.name: selector
params.description:
The querySelector to use for testing if
the element it selects exists

params.name: cntx
params.description:
Optional element to use rather
than the current JS context's document object

return.description: True if the element exists, false otherwise

name: idExists
description: Determines if the element the supplied id identifies exists

params.name: eid
params.description: The id of the element

params.name: cntx
params.description:
Optional document object to use rather
than the current JS context's document object

return.description: True if the element exists, false otherwise

name: findTag
description:
Attempts to find a tag using the supplied function that accepts
an xpath query and an optional starting element and returns
the element the supplied predicate function returns a truthy value for

params.name: xpg
params.description: xpath execution function

params.name: tag
params.description: The tag to be found

params.name: predicate
params.description: Element selecting predicate function

params.name: cntx
params.description: Optional starting element, defaults to `document`

return.description: The desired element if it was found

name: attr
description: Retrieves the value of an elements attribute if it exists

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to retrieve an attribute from

params.name: attr
params.description: The name of the attribute to be retrieved

return.description: The value of the retrieved attribute if it exists

name: attrEq
description:
Tests to determine if the value of elements attribute equals
the supplied value using loose equality

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to retrieve an attribute from

params.name: attr
params.description: The name of the attribute to be retrieved

params.name: shouldEq
params.description: The value the attributes value should equal

return.description:
T/F indicating if the attribute equals. Note
false can indicate the attribute does not equal expected or
the element was null/undefined

name: nthChildElemOf
description: Returns the Nth child of the supplied element (indexing assumes start is 1)

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to retrieve the nth child of

params.name: nth
params.description: The number of the nth child

return.description: The nth child if it exists

name: chainQs
description: Consecutively calls querySelector(selector) on the element returned by the previous invocation

params.name: startingSelectFrom
params.description: The first element to perform querySelector(startingSelector) on

params.name: startingSelector
params.description: The first selector

params.name: selectors
params.description: Additional selections

return.description: Final selected element if it exists

name: addClass
description: Adds a CSS classname to the supplied element

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to add the classname to

params.name: clazz
params.description: The classname to be added

name: removeClass
description: Removes a CSS classname to the supplied element

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to remove the classname to

params.name: clazz
params.description: The classname to be removed

name: hasClass
description: Tests to see if the supplied element has a css class

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to be tested if it has the class

params.name: clazz
params.description: The classname

return.description: T/F indicating if the element has the class

name: getElemSibling
description: Returns the supplied elements next element sibling

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to receive its sibling

return.description: The elements sibling if it exists

name: getElemSiblingAndRemoveElem
description:
Returns the supplied elements next element sibling and removes the
supplied element

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to receive its sibling

return.description: The elements sibling if it exists

name: elemHasZeroBoundingRect

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to be tested

return.description: T/F indicating if all zero or not.

name: getNthParentElement
description: Returns the Nth parent element of the supplied element (indexing assumes start is 1)

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to retrieve the nth parent element of

params.name: nth
params.description: The number of the nth parent

return.description: The nth parent element if it exists

name: getElementPositionWidthHeight
description:
Helper function to get the actual x and y position,
page x and y position (scroll) and the height, width of a given element

types: {y: number, pageY: number, x: number, pageX: number, w: number, h: number}

name: getElementClientPagePosition
description: Get the position of the passed DOM element

types: {clientY: number, clientX: number, pageY: number, pageX: number}

name: getElementClientPageCenter
description: Get the center of the passed DOM element

types: {clientY: number, clientX: number, pageY: number, pageX: number}

name: anySelectorExists
description:
Determines if the element the supplied selector selects exists.

If one of the supplied selectors matches an existing element the idx property
of the returned object is set to the index of the selector in the array and
the success property is set to true.

Otherwise idx = -1 and success = false.

params.name: selectors
params.description:
The query selectors to use for testing if
the elements it selects exist

params.name: cntx
params.description:
Optional element to use rather
than the current JS context's document object

return.description:
The results of the selectors
existence check

name: elementsNameEquals
description: Returns T/F indicating if the elements name (localName) is equal to the supplied name

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to check if its name equals the supplied name

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the desired element

name: nodesNameEquals
description: Returns T/F indicating if the nodes name (nodeName) is equal to the supplied name

params.name: node
params.description: The node to check if its name equals the supplied name

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the desired Node

name: xpathOneOf
description:
Returns the results of evaluating one of the supplied xpath queries if
one of the queries yields results otherwise null/undefined

name: qsOneOf
description:
Returns the results of querySelector using one of the supplied selectors
one if one of the selectors yields results otherwise null/undefined

name: qsaOneOf
description:
Returns the results of querySelectorAll using one of the supplied
selectors if one of the selectors yields results otherwise null/undefined

name: selectedNextElementSibling
description:
Returns the next element sibling of the supplied selector IFF
the selector returns a results and the next element sibling exists
otherwise null/undefined

params.name: selector
params.description:
The selector for the element who's next sibling is
to be returned

params.name: context
params.description: element to use rather than document for the querySelector call

name: lib/events.js

types: {"abort": string, "animationcancel": string, "animationend": string, "animationiteration": string, "animationstart": string, "auxclick": string, "blur": string, "cancel": string, "canplay": string, "canplaythrough": string, "change": string, "click": string, "close": string, "contextmenu": string, "cuechange": string, "dblclick": string, "drag": string, "dragend": string, "dragenter": string, "dragexit": string, "dragleave": string, "dragover": string, "dragstart": string, "drop": string, "durationchange": string, "emptied": string, "ended": string, "error": string, "focus": string, "gotpointercapture": string, "input": string, "invalid": string, "keydown": string, "keypress": string, "keyup": string, "load": string, "loadeddata": string, "loadedmetadata": string, "loadend": string, "loadstart": string, "lostpointercapture": string, "mousedown": string, "mouseenter": string, "mouseleave": string, "mousemove": string, "mouseout": string, "mouseover": string, "mouseup": string, "pause": string, "play": string, "playing": string, "pointercancel": string, "pointerdown": string, "pointerenter": string, "pointerleave": string, "pointermove": string, "pointerout": string, "pointerover": string, "pointerup": string, "progress": string, "ratechange": string, "reset": string, "resize": string, "scroll": string, "securitypolicyviolation": string, "seeked": string, "seeking": string, "select": string, "stalled": string, "submit": string, "suspend": string, "timeupdate": string, "toggle": string, "touchcancel": string, "touchend": string, "touchmove": string, "touchstart": string, "transitioncancel": string, "transitionend": string, "transitionrun": string, "transitionstart": string, "volumechange": string, "waiting": string, "wheel": string, "copy": string, "cut": string, "paste": string, "fullscreenchange": string, "fullscreenerror": string}

name: lib/general.js
getViaPath
description:
Retrieves the property of an object, or item in array at index, based
on the supplied path.
examples:
const obj = { a: { b: { c: [1, 2, 3] } } }
  const two = getViaPath(obj, 'a', 'b', 'c', 1); // two == 2

params.name: obj
params.description: An object

name: noop
description: This function is a no op

name: autobind
description:
Automatically binds the non-inherited functions of the supplied
class to itself.

name: objectHasProps
description:
Returns T/F if the supplied object has all of the supplied properties.
The existence check is `obj[prop] != null`

params.name: obj
params.description: The object to be tested

params.name: props
params.description: The property names

name: globalWithPropsExist
description:
Returns T/F if an global property (on window) exists and has
all properties. The existence check is `obj[prop] != null`

params.name: global
params.description: The name of the global

params.name: props
params.description: The property names

name: extractProps
description:
Returns a new object with the properties of the object
on the new object

params.name: object
params.description: The object to extract properties from

params.name: props
params.description: The property names to be extracted

return.description: The new object if the original object was not null

name: compose
description:
Composes multiple functions from right to left into a single function.
The rightmost function can take multiple arguments with the remaining
functions taking only a single argument, the return value of the previous
invocation.

params.name: funcs
params.description: The functions to compose.

return.description:
A function obtained by composing the functions
from right to left. For example, compose(f, g, h) is identical to doing
(...args) => f(g(h(...args))).

name: composeAsync
description:
Composes multiple async or Promise returning functions from right to
left into a single function. The rightmost function can take multiple arguments
with the remaining functions taking only a single argument, the return value
of the previous invocation.

params.name: funcs
params.description: The functions to compose.

return.description:
A function obtained by composing the functions
from right to left. For example, composeAsync(f, g, h) is identical to doing
(...args) => h(...args).then(result => g(result).then(result => f(result)).

name: composeIterators
description:
Composes multiple Iterator returning functions from right to
left into a single function. The rightmost function can take multiple arguments
with the remaining functions taking only a single argument, the iterator returned
by the previous invocation. The composition of iterators can thought of
as chaining multiple iterators together, that is to say feeding the yielded results
of each iterator from right to left. This can be useful for chaining cascading
ordered actions.

params.name: funcs
params.description: The Iterator returning functions to be composed (chained)

return.description:
A function obtained by composing the functions
from right to left. See the documentations example for details

name: composeAsyncIterators
description:
Composes multiple AsyncIterator returning functions from right to
left into a single function. The rightmost function can take multiple arguments
with the remaining functions taking only a single argument, the iterator returned
by the previous invocation. The composition of AsyncIterator can thought of
as chaining multiple AsyncIterator together, that is to say feeding the yielded results
of each iterator from right to left. This can be useful for chaining cascading asynchronous
ordered actions.

params.name: funcs
params.description: The AsyncIterator returning functions to be composed (chained)

return.description:
A function obtained by composing the functions
from right to left. See the documentations example for details

name: lib/index.js
content:
export { BehaviorRunner, initRunnableBehavior } from './behaviorRunner';
export {
  locationContains,
  locationEquals,
  waitForHistoryManipToChangeLocation
} from './browser';
export {
  click,
  clickAndWaitFor,
  clickInContext,
  clickInContextWithDelay,
  clickWithDelay,
  clickWithDelay2,
  scrollAllIntoViewAndClick,
  scrollAllIntoViewAndClickWithDelay,
  scrollIntoViewAndClick,
  scrollIntoViewAndClick2,
  scrollIntoViewAndClickWithDelay,
  scrollIntoViewAndClickWithDelay2,
  selectClickAndWaitFor,
  selectElemAndClick,
  selectElemAndClickWithDelay,
  selectElemFromAndClick,
  selectElemFromAndClickWithDelay,
  selectFromAndClickNTimes,
  selectFromAndClickNTimesWithDelay,
  selectFromAndClickUntilNullWithDelay
} from './clicks';
export {
  delay,
  DelayAmount1Second,
  DelayAmount2Seconds,
  DelayAmount3Seconds,
  DelayAmount4Seconds,
  DelayAmount5Seconds,
  domCompletePromise,
  resolveWhenBehaviorUnPaused,
  secondsToDelayAmount,
  setIntervalP,
  setTimeoutP,
  waitForAdditionalElemChildren,
  waitForAndSelectElement,
  waitForPredicate,
  waitForPredicateAtMax
} from './delays';
export {
  addBehaviorStyle,
  addClass,
  anySelectorExists,
  attr,
  attrEq,
  canAcessIf,
  chainFistChildElemOf,
  chainLastChildElemOf,
  chainNthChildElemOf,
  chainQs,
  documentScrollPosition,
  elementsNameEquals,
  elementTextContains,
  elementTextEndsWith,
  elementTextEqs,
  elementTextStartsWith,
  elementTextStartsWithAndEndsWith,
  elemHasSibling,
  elemHasZeroBoundingRect,
  elemInnerText,
  elemInnerTextEqs,
  elemOffsetTopZero,
  elemTextContent,
  filteredQs,
  findTag,
  firstChildElementOf,
  getElementClientPageCenter,
  getElementClientPagePosition,
  getElementPositionWidthHeight,
  getElemSibling,
  getElemSiblingAndRemoveElem,
  getNthParentElement,
  hasClass,
  id,
  idExists,
  isClasslessElem,
  isElemNotVisible,
  lastChildElementOf,
  markElemAsVisited,
  maybePolyfillXPG,
  maybeRemoveElem,
  maybeRemoveElemById,
  nodesNameEquals,
  nthChildElemOf,
  numElemChildren,
  qs,
  qsa,
  qsaOneOf,
  qsOneOf,
  removeClass,
  selectedNextElementSibling,
  selectorExists,
  splitElemInnerText,
  splitElemTextContents,
  xpathOneOf,
  xpathSnapShot,
  xpathSnapShotArray
} from './dom';
export {
  createMouseEvent,
  fireEventOn,
  fireMouseEventsOnElement,
  HTMLElementEventMap,
  waitForEventTargetToFireEvent
} from './events';
export {
  autobind,
  autoFetchFromDoc,
  compose,
  composeAsync,
  composeAsyncIterators,
  composeIterators,
  extractProps,
  getViaPath,
  globalWithPropsExist,
  noop,
  objectHasProps,
  promiseResolveReject,
  safeFetch,
  sendAutoFetchWorkerURLs
} from './general';
export {
  findAllMediaElementsAndPlay,
  noExceptPlayMediaElement,
  selectAndPlay,
  selectIdAndPlay
} from './media';
export { MutationStream } from './mutations';
export {
  addOutlink,
  addOutLinks,
  collectOutlinksFrom,
  collectOutlinksFromDoc
} from './outlinkCollector';
export { buildCustomPostStepFn, doneOrWait } from './postStepFNs';
export {
  findChildWithKey,
  getInternalRootOnElem,
  getReactRootContainer,
  getReactRootHostElem,
  reactInstanceFromDOMElem,
  reactInstancesFromElements,
  reactProps
} from './reactUtils';
export {
  canScrollMore,
  scrollDownByElemHeight,
  scrollDownByElemHeightWithDelay,
  scrollIntoView,
  scrollIntoViewAndWaitFor,
  scrollIntoViewWithDelay,
  scrollToElemOffset,
  scrollToElemOffsetWithDelay,
  scrollWindowBy,
  scrollWindowByWithDelay,
  scrollWindowDownBy,
  scrollWindowDownByWithDelay
} from './scrolls';
export {
  camelCase,
  camelCaseToDashDelim,
  camelCaseToUnderscoreDelim,
  capitalize,
  collapseWhitespace,
  isAlpha,
  isAlphaNumeric,
  isEmptyString,
  isLower,
  isNumeric,
  isUpper,
  stringBetween,
  titleCase,
  toBoolean,
  toFloat,
  toInt
} from './strings';
export {
  traverseChildrenOf,
  traverseChildrenOfLoaderParent
} from './traversals';

name: lib/media.js
selectAndPlay
description: Calls the play method of the element returned by the querySelector

params.name: selector
params.description: The query selector to select a media element

params.name: cntx
params.description:
Optional element/Document to use
to perform the querySelector call from

name: selectIdAndPlay
description: Calls the play method of the element returned by calling document.getElementById

params.name: eid
params.description: The id of the media element

params.name: cntx
params.description: Optional document object to use

name: noExceptPlayMediaElement
description:
Calls the play function of the supplied element catching the exception thrown
if any was thrown. Returns true indicating call to play was successful otherwise false

return.description: Returns false if an exception occurred or true if playing was sucessful

name: findAllMediaElementsAndPlay
description:
Calls the play function on all audio and video elements found in the document.
If context is supplied, the selection of audio and video elements is done from
the supplied context.

params.name: cntx
params.description:
Optional element to use rather
than the current JS context's document object

name: lib/mutations.js
MutationStream
description: Observe dom mutation using a MutationObserver as a stream (AsyncIterator)

name: observe
description: Start observing an element for mutations

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to be observed for mutations

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object accepted by mutation observers

name: observeStream
description:
Start observing an element for mutations and receive an async iterator
yielding the observed mutations

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to be observed for mutations

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object accepted by mutation observers

name: predicatedStream
description:
Creates a conditional mutation stream. If the startPredicate
does not return true then the the observer discontents ending the stream.
Otherwise the stream continues to emit mutations until the observer is
disconnected or the stopPredicate returns true. The stopPredicate is polled
at 1.5 second intervals when the observer is waiting for the next mutation.

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to be observed for mutations

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object accepted by mutation observers

params.name: startPredicate
params.description:
Predicate function right before
mutations are yielded to determine if the stream should end immediately or not

params.name: stopPredicate
params.description:
Predicate function polled
while waiting for mutations to occur that returns false to indicate
the stream should end.

name: disconnect
description: Disconnects the mutation observer and ends the stream

name: _getNext
description: Returns a promise that resolves with the next observed mutation

name: streamItr
description:
Returns an stream (async iterator) that yields
the observed mutations. Must have called {@link observe} before
calling this method, otherwise no mutations will be yielded

name: predicateStreamItr
description:
Returns an mutation stream that ends if the startPredicate returns false
otherwise keeps the stream alive until disconnect or the stopPredicate, polled
at 1.5 second intervals when waiting for next mutation, returns false.
Automatically disconnects at the end.

params.name: startPredicate
params.description:
Predicate function right before
mutations are yielded to determine if the stream should end immediately or not

params.name: stopPredicate
params.description:
Predicate function polled
while waiting for mutations to occur that returns false to indicate
the stream should end.

name: lib/outlinkCollector.js
addOutLinks
description: Add the array/nodelist of A or Anchor tags href properties the collected outlinks

params.name: toAdd
params.description:
The elements with
href properties that are to be added to the collected outlinks

name: collectOutlinksFromDoc
description: Collects the outlinks from the document

name: collectOutlinksFrom
description: Collects outlinks form the supplied element

params.name: queryFrom
params.description:
The element to collect outlinks
from

name: addOutlink
description: Add the URL or href value of the supplied argument

params.name: elemOrString
params.description:
The
element with href property or string to add to the collected outlinks

name: lib/postStepFNs.js

types: function(state: {done: boolean, value: *}): {done: boolean, wait: boolean}

name: lib/reactUtils.js
getReactRootHostElem
description: Returns the root host element of an react application (id = react-root)

params.name: alternativeId
params.description: An alternative id to use rather than the default

name: getInternalRootOnElem
description:
Returns the internal root object added by react on the supplied element.
Property `_internalRoot`

name: getReactRootContainer
description: Returns the root container object added by react

name: reactInstanceFromDOMElem
description: Returns the react instance object that lives on the live element

params.name: elem
params.description:
The element to have its
react instance extracted from

name: reactInstancesFromElements
description:
Converts the supplied array of elements into an array of objects
each with property node (the live dom element) and reactInstance (the live
react component). An optional selection function can be supplied that
receives the rendered components key and returns T/F to indicate if the
component and element is to be selected

params.name: elems
params.description:
The array of elements to
get their react instances

params.name: selectingFn
params.description:
Optional selection
function that takes a components key and returns T/F indicating if the
component is selected

name: findChildWithKey
description:
Walks the children of a react component to
find the one that has the supplied key

params.name: reactInstance
params.description:
The react instance who's children are
to be descended looking for the one with key

params.name: key
params.description: The key of the child to retrieve

return.description: The found child if found

name: lib/scrolls.js
scrollIntoView
description:
Scrolls the supplied element into view.

Scroll behavior:
 - behavior: smooth
 - block: center
 - inline: center

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to be scrolled into view

name: scrollIntoViewWithDelay
description:
Scrolls the supplied element into view, afterwards waits for the specified delay time

Scroll behavior:
 - behavior: smooth
 - block: center
 - inline: center

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to be scrolled into view with delay

params.name: delayTime
params.description: How long is the delay

name: scrollIntoViewAndWaitFor
description:
Scrolls the supplied element into view and then waits for the supplied predicate function to return true

Scroll behavior:
 - behavior: smooth
 - block: center
 - inline: center

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to be scrolled into view with delay

params.name: predicate
params.description:
Function returning T/F to indicate when the
condition waited for has been satisfied

name: scrollToElemOffset
description:
Scrolls the window by the supplied elements offsetTop. If the elements
offsetTop is zero then {@link scrollIntoView} is used

params.name: elem
params.description: The element who's offsetTop will be used to scroll by

name: scrollToElemOffsetWithDelay
description:
Scrolls the window by the supplied elements offsetTop. If the elements
offsetTop is zero then {@link scrollIntoView} is used

params.name: elem
params.description: The element who's offsetTop will be used to scroll by

params.name: delayTime
params.description: How long is the delay

name: scrollDownByElemHeight
description: Scrolls down by the elements height

params.name: elem
params.description:
The element who's height
to scroll down by

name: scrollDownByElemHeightWithDelay
description:
Scrolls down by supplied elements height and then waits for
the supplied delay time.

params.name: elem
params.description: The element to be

params.name: delayTime
params.description: How long is the delay

name: canScrollMore
description: Determines if we can scroll down any more

return.description: T/F indicating if we can scroll down some more

name: scrollWindowBy
description: Scrolls the window by the supplied x and y amount

params.name: x
params.description: Amount to scroll in the x direction

params.name: y
params.description: Amount to scroll in the y direction

name: scrollWindowDownBy
description: Scrolls the window down by the supplied amount

params.name: amount
params.description: Amount to scroll the down by

name: scrollWindowByWithDelay
description: Scrolls the window by the supplied x and y amount

params.name: x
params.description: Amount to scroll in the x direction

params.name: y
params.description: Amount to scroll in the y direction

name: scrollWindowDownByWithDelay
description: Scrolls the window down by the supplied amount

params.name: amount
params.description: Amount to scroll the down by

name: lib/strings.js
lib/traversals.js

content:
# wr-behaviors
Webrecorders behavior standard library

Files:
- behaviorRunner.js: A thin wrapper around the execution of a behaviors actions in order to support behavior pausing
- browser.js: functions for handling history manipulation etc
- clicks.js: functions for clicking elements
- delays: functions for applying delays or waiting for condition
- dom: functions for interacting with the dom
- events: functions for handling events and event targets
- general: general utility functions
- media: functions for handling media elements
- mutations: watch for mutations as stream
- outlinkCollector: functions for collecting outlinks
- postStepFNs.js: utility functions for performing a non behavior action after a behavior's action
- reactUtils.js: functions for working with react based applications
- scrolls.js: functions for scrolling the window
- strings.js: functions for manipulating strings
- traversals.js: functions for traversing the dom
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "wr-behaviors",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "main": "index.js",
  "license": "MIT",
  "dependencies": {
    "@babel/generator": "^7.3.4",
    "@babel/highlight": "^7.0.0",
    "@babel/parser": "^7.3.4",
    "@babel/template": "^7.2.2",
    "@babel/traverse": "^7.3.4",
    "@babel/types": "^7.3.4",
    "acorn": "^6.1.1",
    "chalk": "^2.4.2",
    "cheerio": "^1.0.0-rc.2",
    "chokidar": "^2.1.2",
    "commander": "^2.19.0",
    "fastify": "^2.0.0",
    "fastify-graceful-shutdown": "^2.0.0",
    "fastify-plugin": "^1.5.0",
    "fastparallel": "^2.3.0",
    "find-my-way": "^2.0.1",
    "fs-extra": "^7.0.1",
    "js-yaml": "^3.12.2",
    "plur": "^3.0.1",
    "pluralize": "^7.0.0",
    "prettier": "^1.16.4",
    "pretty-time": "^1.1.0",
    "qs": "^6.6.0",
    "rollup": "^1.3.2",
    "rollup-plugin-alias": "^1.5.1",
    "rollup-plugin-cleanup": "^3.1.1",
    "rollup-plugin-node-resolve": "^4.0.1",
    "ts-morph": "^1.2.0",
    "typescript": "^3.3.3333",
    "uuid": "^3.3.2"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "build-behaviors": "node --harmony-await-optimization ./internal/behaviorCLI.js -c ./behavior-config.yml -b",
    "build-prod": "rollup -c rollup.prod.config.js",
    "build-dev": "rollup -c rollup.dev.config.js",
    "build-deving-warch": "rollup --watch -c rollup.deving.config.js",
    "build-deving": "rollup -c rollup.deving.config.js",
    "build-watch": "rollup --watch -c rollup.dev.config.js",
    "build-docs": "esdoc",
    "publish-docs": "gh-pages -d docs"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@types/cheerio": "^0.22.10",
    "@types/fs-extra": "^5.0.5",
    "babel-eslint": "^10.0.1",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-external-webapi-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-publish-html-plugin": "^1.1.2",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^5.14.1",
    "eslint-config-prettier": "^4.1.0",
    "eslint-plugin-prettier": "^3.0.1",
    "gh-pages": "^2.0.1",
    "inquirer": "^6.2.2",
    "request": "^2.88.0",
    "request-promise-native": "^1.0.7"
  },
  "engines": {
    "node": ">=11"
  },
  "resolutions": {
    "*/**/acorn": "^6.1.0",
    "*/**/graceful-fs": "^4.1.15",
    "*/**/universalify": "^0.1.2",
    "*/**/tslib": "^1.9.3",
    "*/**/typescript": "^3.3.3333"
  }
}
